title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 2 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 1 Corinthians chapter 2 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 2 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 1 Corinthians Chapter 2.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 2:2, what did Paul determine not to know among the Corinthians?
options: Anything except Jesus Christ and Him crucified
questions.correctAnswer: Anything except Jesus Christ and Him crucified
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 2:2 states Paul determined not to know anything among them except Jesus Christ and Him crucified.

questions.question: What was Paul's condition when he was with the Corinthians as described in 1 Corinthians 2:3?
questions.correctAnswer: Weakness, fear, and much trembling
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 2:3 describes Paul as being with them in weakness, fear, and much trembling.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 2:4, Paul's preaching was not with what kind of words?
questions.correctAnswer: Enticing words of man's wisdom
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 2:4 says Paul's speech and preaching was not with enticing words of man's wisdom.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 2:5, in what should the faith of the Corinthians stand?
questions.correctAnswer: The power of God
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 2:5 explains that faith should stand in the power of God, not the wisdom of men.

questions.question: Who does 1 Corinthians 2:6 say the wisdom is spoken among?
questions.correctAnswer: Them that are perfect
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 2:6 states wisdom is spoken among them that are perfect.

questions.question: What kind of wisdom is revealed according to 1 Corinthians 2:7?
options: The wisdom of the princes of this world
questions.correctAnswer: The hidden wisdom of God
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 2:7 speaks of the wisdom of God in a mystery, the hidden wisdom ordained before the world.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 2:8, why did the princes of this world not know the wisdom of God?
options: Because if they had, they would not have crucified the Lord of glory
Because it was secret knowledge only for the apostles
Because it was written in a foreign language
Because it was revealed only after Christ's resurrection
questions.correctAnswer: Because if they had, they would not have crucified the Lord of glory
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 2:8 explains the princes of this world did not know the wisdom of God, or they would not have crucified the Lord of glory.

questions.question: What does 1 Corinthians 2:9 say eye hath not seen, nor ear heard?
options: The things which God hath prepared for them that love Him
questions.correctAnswer: The things which God hath prepared for them that love Him
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 2:9 quotes the scripture about things prepared by God for those who love Him, unseen and unheard by man.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 2:10, how has God revealed the deep things to us?
questions.correctAnswer: By His Spirit
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 2:10 states God hath revealed the deep things unto us by His Spirit.

questions.question: 1 Corinthians 2:11 compares the spirit of man to what other spirit?
questions.correctAnswer: The Spirit of God
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 2:11 compares the spirit of man which knows the things of a man to the Spirit of God which knows the things of God.

questions.question: True or False: 1 Corinthians 2:14 says the natural man can receive the things of the Spirit of God.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 2:14 states the natural man receiveth not the things of the Spirit of God because they are spiritually discerned.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Corinthians 2:15, he that is spiritual judgeth all things.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 2:15 says he that is spiritual judgeth all things.

questions.question: True or False: 1 Corinthians 2:13 says we speak in words taught by man's wisdom.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 2:13 says we speak not in words which man's wisdom teacheth, but which the Holy Ghost teacheth.

questions.question: Complete this verse from 1 Corinthians 2:16: 'For who hath known the mind of the Lord, that he may ______ him? But we have the mind of Christ.'
questions.correctAnswer: instruct
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 2:16 says, 'For who hath known the mind of the Lord, that he may instruct him? But we have the mind of Christ.'

questions.question: Complete this verse from 1 Corinthians 2:12: 'Now we have received, not the spirit of the world, but the spirit which is of God; that we might know the things that are ______ given to us of God.'
questions.correctAnswer: freely
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 2:12 says we might know the things that are freely given to us of God.

medium.title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 2 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 1 Corinthians Chapter 2 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with fear and weakness in their ministry. Based on 1 Corinthians 2, what biblical truth would you share about relying on God?
options: Ministry succeeds through human wisdom and eloquence
Faith should stand in the power of God, not human wisdom
Fear and trembling show a lack of faith
Preaching should always use enticing words to persuade
questions.correctAnswer: Faith should stand in the power of God, not human wisdom
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 2:1-5 shows Paul came in weakness and fear, not relying on human wisdom but on the Spirit’s power so that faith stands in God's power, not man's wisdom.

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 2 teach us about humility in sharing the Gospel?
options: We should boast in our eloquence and wisdom
Focus only on Jesus Christ and Him crucified
Avoid mentioning Jesus to prevent offense
Use worldly wisdom to win arguments
questions.correctAnswer: Focus only on Jesus Christ and Him crucified
questions.explanation: According to 1 Corinthians 2:2, Paul determined to know nothing among them except Jesus Christ and Him crucified, showing humility by focusing on the core Gospel rather than human wisdom.

questions.question: In the context of 1 Corinthians 2, what is the role of the Holy Spirit in understanding spiritual truths?
options: The Spirit teaches spiritual truths through human wisdom
The Spirit reveals the deep things of God to believers
The Spirit is irrelevant to knowing God’s wisdom
The Spirit only helps in emotional experiences
questions.correctAnswer: The Spirit reveals the deep things of God to believers
questions.explanation: Verses 10-13 explain that God reveals His wisdom by the Spirit, who searches all things and teaches spiritual truths beyond human wisdom.

questions.question: A believer wonders why some people reject the Gospel message. Based on 1 Corinthians 2, what biblical insight can you share?
options: The natural man cannot receive the things of the Spirit
People reject the Gospel because it is too simple
Rejection is due to lack of education
questions.correctAnswer: The natural man cannot receive the things of the Spirit
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 2:14 teaches that the natural man does not receive the things of the Spirit of God, because they are spiritually discerned and seem foolishness to him.

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 2 guide believers in discerning spiritual matters within the church?
options: Only leaders can judge spiritual matters
The spiritual person judges all things by the Spirit
Judgment should be based on outward appearances
questions.correctAnswer: The spiritual person judges all things by the Spirit
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 2:15 says the spiritual person judges all things but is not judged by others, emphasizing reliance on the Spirit for discernment.

questions.question: When sharing the Gospel, what attitude does Paul model in 1 Corinthians 2 that helps us with humility and reliance on God?
options: Relying on the Spirit’s demonstration and power
Avoiding any mention of the cross
questions.correctAnswer: Relying on the Spirit’s demonstration and power
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 2:4-5 states Paul's preaching was not with enticing words but in demonstration of the Spirit and power so faith rests on God's power, not human wisdom.

questions.question: A believer feels discouraged because others do not seem to understand spiritual truths. According to 1 Corinthians 2, what encouragement can you offer?
options: Spiritual truths are only for church leaders
The Spirit reveals these truths to believers who have His Spirit
Spiritual truths are easy to understand naturally
Human wisdom is the key to understanding God
questions.correctAnswer: The Spirit reveals these truths to believers who have His Spirit
questions.explanation: As 1 Corinthians 2:12 explains, believers have received the Spirit of God to know the things freely given by God, highlighting the Spirit’s role in revelation.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Corinthians 2, Paul came to the Corinthians with impressive speech and human wisdom to establish his credibility.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 2:1 states Paul did not come with excellency of speech or wisdom but declared the testimony of God, demonstrating humility and reliance on God.

questions.question: True or False: 1 Corinthians 2 teaches that the wisdom of this world and its rulers is sufficient for understanding God’s plan.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verses 6-8 clarify that the wisdom spoken among the perfect is not of this world or its rulers, who did not understand God's hidden wisdom and crucified Christ.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to 1 Corinthians 2, the things which God has prepared for those who love Him are beyond what ________ has seen or heard.
questions.correctAnswer: man’s eye
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 2:9 states, 'Eye hath not seen, nor ear heard, neither have entered into the heart of man, the things which God hath prepared,' emphasizing the surpassing nature of God's promises.

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 2 instruct believers to speak about spiritual truths within the church?
options: Using words taught by human wisdom
Comparing spiritual things with spiritual, taught by the Holy Spirit
Avoiding spiritual topics to prevent confusion
Using rhetorical flourishes to impress listeners
questions.correctAnswer: Comparing spiritual things with spiritual, taught by the Holy Spirit
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 2:13 teaches that spiritual truths are spoken not in human wisdom but as the Holy Ghost teaches, comparing spiritual things with spiritual.

questions.question: When facing trials and persecution, what does 1 Corinthians 2 teach about the source of true wisdom and strength?
options: Relying on human strength and understanding
Relying on God’s hidden wisdom and Spirit
questions.correctAnswer: Relying on God’s hidden wisdom and Spirit
questions.explanation: Verses 7 and 10 reveal that God’s wisdom, hidden and revealed by the Spirit, is the source of true strength and glory amid trials.

questions.question: A believer wants to grow in spiritual discernment. Based on 1 Corinthians 2, what practice should they pursue?
options: Rely on their own intellect to understand spiritual matters
Seek the Spirit of God to teach and guide understanding
Only listen to human teachers without testing the Spirit
Avoid studying spiritual things to prevent confusion
questions.correctAnswer: Seek the Spirit of God to teach and guide understanding
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 2:11-13 explains that the Spirit of God reveals the deep things of God and teaches spiritual truths, encouraging believers to rely on the Spirit.

questions.question: What does 1 Corinthians 2 teach about the mind of a believer compared to the mind of the Lord?
options: Believers have the mind of Christ
Believers cannot understand God’s mind at all
Believers have a mind separate and opposed to Christ
The mind of the Lord is unknowable and irrelevant
questions.correctAnswer: Believers have the mind of Christ
questions.explanation: 1 Corinthians 2:16 states that we have the mind of Christ, showing believers share in Christ’s understanding and wisdom.

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 2 encourage believers to place their faith during trials and challenges?
options: In human wisdom and clever arguments
In the power of God demonstrated through the Spirit
In material success and worldly approval
questions.correctAnswer: In the power of God demonstrated through the Spirit
questions.explanation: Verses 4-5 emphasize that faith should stand in God’s power, not human wisdom, encouraging reliance on the Spirit especially in trials.

hard.title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 2 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 1 Corinthians Chapter 2.

questions.question: What was Paul's primary focus when he came to the Corinthians, according to 1 Corinthians 2:2?
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus Christ and Him crucified
questions.explanation: Paul explicitly states in 1 Corinthians 2:2 that he determined to know nothing among them except Jesus Christ and Him crucified, emphasizing the centrality of the crucifixion in his message.

questions.question: In 1 Corinthians 2:4, Paul's preaching is described as demonstrating what?
questions.correctAnswer: The Spirit and power
questions.explanation: Paul contrasts his preaching with enticing words of human wisdom, stating it was a demonstration of the Spirit and power, highlighting the divine rather than human source of his message.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 2:5, what should the Corinthians' faith stand in?
questions.correctAnswer: The power of God
questions.explanation: Paul emphasizes that faith should not rest on human wisdom but on God's power, underscoring a supernatural foundation for Christian belief.

questions.question: What kind of wisdom does Paul say he speaks among the perfect in 1 Corinthians 2:6?
options: Not the wisdom of this world nor of its princes
The wisdom of the Greek philosophers
questions.correctAnswer: Not the wisdom of this world nor of its princes
questions.explanation: Paul clarifies that the wisdom he speaks is different from worldly wisdom or that of worldly rulers, which are destined to perish.

questions.question: What is described as the 'hidden wisdom' in 1 Corinthians 2:7?
options: The wisdom of God ordained before the world unto our glory
The laws of the Old Testament
questions.correctAnswer: The wisdom of God ordained before the world unto our glory
questions.explanation: This 'hidden wisdom' refers to divine wisdom predestined by God before creation, intended for believers' glory, demonstrating God's eternal plan.

questions.question: Why, according to 1 Corinthians 2:8, did the princes of this world not understand the wisdom of God?
options: Because if they had known, they would not have crucified the Lord of glory
Because they were too focused on politics
Because they rejected all religious teachings
questions.correctAnswer: Because if they had known, they would not have crucified the Lord of glory
questions.explanation: Paul explains that their ignorance of God's wisdom led to the crucifixion of Jesus, showing the tragic irony of worldly rulers opposing divine purpose.

questions.question: Which Old Testament concept does Paul allude to in 1 Corinthians 2:9 when he speaks of things not seen or heard?
options: Isaiah's prophecy about God's preparations for those who love Him
questions.correctAnswer: Isaiah's prophecy about God's preparations for those who love Him
questions.explanation: Paul quotes Isaiah 64:4, emphasizing the incomprehensible blessings God has prepared, connecting New Testament revelation to Old Testament prophecy.

questions.question: How does 1 Corinthians 2:10 describe the way God reveals deep spiritual truths?
options: By His Spirit searching all things
questions.correctAnswer: By His Spirit searching all things
questions.explanation: The Spirit of God reveals what is hidden, exploring the depths of divine mysteries beyond human understanding.

questions.question: What analogy is used in 1 Corinthians 2:11 to describe how the Spirit of God knows divine things?
options: As the spirit of a man knows the things of a man
As the wind knows its direction
As the sun reveals the day
questions.correctAnswer: As the spirit of a man knows the things of a man
questions.explanation: Paul uses this analogy to show that just as a person's spirit knows their own thoughts, the Spirit of God knows God's thoughts intimately.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 2:12, what spirit have believers received?
options: Not the spirit of the world but the spirit of God
questions.correctAnswer: Not the spirit of the world but the spirit of God
questions.explanation: Believers receive God's Spirit to understand the gifts freely given by God, distinguishing Christian experience from worldly influences.

questions.question: In 1 Corinthians 2:13, how are spiritual truths communicated?
options: Not with man's wisdom but taught by the Holy Spirit
questions.correctAnswer: Not with man's wisdom but taught by the Holy Spirit
questions.explanation: Paul emphasizes that spiritual teachings come from the Holy Spirit, not human intellect, establishing the divine origin of Christian doctrine.

questions.question: What is the natural man's response to the things of the Spirit of God in 1 Corinthians 2:14?
options: He receives them not, for they are foolishness to him
questions.correctAnswer: He receives them not, for they are foolishness to him
questions.explanation: The natural man cannot understand spiritual things because they require spiritual discernment, highlighting the necessity of the Spirit for comprehension.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Corinthians 2:15, the spiritual person judges all things and is himself judged by many men.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The verse states the spiritual person judges all things but is judged by no one, indicating spiritual discernment grants a unique authority and protection.

questions.question: What does 1 Corinthians 2:16 claim believers possess?
questions.correctAnswer: The mind of Christ
questions.explanation: Paul asserts that believers have the mind of Christ, enabling them to understand divine truths and live according to God's will.

questions.question: Paul’s approach in 1 Corinthians 2:1–3 is characterized by which of the following?
questions.correctAnswer: Weakness, fear, and much trembling
questions.explanation: Paul humbly acknowledges his vulnerable state when ministering, emphasizing reliance on God's power rather than human confidence.

theological.title: 1 Corinthians Chapter 2 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 1 Corinthians Chapter 2 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 2:2, what was Paul's determined focus when he came to the Corinthians?
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus Christ, and him crucified
questions.explanation: Paul explicitly states in 1 Corinthians 2:2 that he determined to know nothing among the Corinthians except Jesus Christ and him crucified. This focus aligns with other Scripture emphasizing Christ's centrality in salvation such as John 3:16, Romans 5:8, Galatians 6:14, Philippians 2:8, and Hebrews 12:2.

questions.question: What does Paul say about his manner of preaching to the Corinthians in 1 Corinthians 2:4?
options: It was with demonstration of the Spirit and of power
It was full of enticing words of man's wisdom
It was based on human philosophy
It was filled with rhetorical eloquence
questions.correctAnswer: It was with demonstration of the Spirit and of power
questions.explanation: Paul contrasts his preaching with human wisdom and eloquence, emphasizing the Spirit's power (1 Corinthians 2:4). This reflects the biblical theme that true spiritual power comes from God, as seen in Acts 1:8, Romans 8:11, Ephesians 3:16, and 2 Timothy 1:7.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the Spirit's demonstration in preaching, according to 1 Corinthians 2:5?
options: That faith should stand in the power of God, not in the wisdom of men
To impress the crowd with eloquent speech
To gain social status among believers
questions.correctAnswer: That faith should stand in the power of God, not in the wisdom of men
questions.explanation: Paul emphasizes that faith must rest on God's power rather than human wisdom (1 Corinthians 2:5). This aligns with biblical teaching that salvation and faith rest on God's sovereign action, as seen in Romans 1:16, Ephesians 2:8-9, 1 Peter 1:5, and Hebrews 11:1.

questions.question: How does Paul describe the wisdom he speaks among the 'perfect' in 1 Corinthians 2:6?
options: Not the wisdom of this world nor of its princes
questions.correctAnswer: Not the wisdom of this world nor of its princes
questions.explanation: Paul clarifies that the wisdom he speaks is different from worldly wisdom or that of earthly rulers (1 Corinthians 2:6). This divine wisdom is also described in James 3:17, Colossians 2:3, Proverbs 3:13, and Isaiah 55:8-9, showing God's wisdom surpasses human understanding.

questions.question: In 1 Corinthians 2:7, what characterizes the wisdom Paul speaks of?
options: A hidden wisdom ordained by God before the world for our glory
The wisdom of the scribes and Pharisees
questions.correctAnswer: A hidden wisdom ordained by God before the world for our glory
questions.explanation: Paul describes this wisdom as a mystery hidden and ordained by God prior to creation for believers' glory (1 Corinthians 2:7). This concept is echoed in Ephesians 1:9-10, Romans 16:25-27, Colossians 1:26-27, and Isaiah 45:15, emphasizing God's eternal plan revealed in Christ.

questions.question: Why, according to 1 Corinthians 2:8, did the 'princes of this world' not understand God's wisdom?
options: Because if they had known, they would not have crucified the Lord of glory
questions.correctAnswer: Because if they had known, they would not have crucified the Lord of glory
questions.explanation: The rulers' ignorance of God's wisdom led them to crucify Jesus, the Lord of glory (1 Corinthians 2:8). This reflects Isaiah 53:3-6, Psalm 22, Acts 2:23, John 1:10-11, and Luke 23:34, showing human rejection of divine salvation despite God's plan.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from 1 Corinthians 2:9: 'Eye hath not seen, nor ear heard, neither have entered into the heart of man, the things which God hath prepared for them that ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: love him
questions.explanation: The verse emphasizes that God's prepared blessings are for those who love Him (1 Corinthians 2:9). This corresponds with Deuteronomy 7:9, Psalm 31:23, John 14:21, Romans 8:28, and 1 John 4:19, highlighting the relational aspect of salvation.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 2:10, how has God revealed the deep things of God to believers?
options: By his Spirit, which searches all things
questions.correctAnswer: By his Spirit, which searches all things
questions.explanation: God reveals mysteries through the Holy Spirit who searches all things, including deep spiritual truths (1 Corinthians 2:10). This is consistent with John 16:13, Romans 8:14, 1 John 2:27, Isaiah 40:13, and Joel 2:28.

questions.question: What analogy does Paul use in 1 Corinthians 2:11 to explain how the Spirit knows the things of God?
options: As a man's spirit knows the things of a man
As a king knows his kingdom
As a teacher knows his lesson
As the sun knows the day
questions.correctAnswer: As a man's spirit knows the things of a man
questions.explanation: Paul compares human self-knowledge by the spirit within to how only the Spirit of God knows God's things (1 Corinthians 2:11). This highlights divine revelation and is supported by Psalm 139:1-4, Jeremiah 17:10, Romans 8:27, and Isaiah 40:13.

questions.question: What spirit have believers received according to 1 Corinthians 2:12?
options: The Spirit which is of God, not the spirit of the world
questions.correctAnswer: The Spirit which is of God, not the spirit of the world
questions.explanation: Believers receive the Spirit from God to understand spiritual blessings, contrasting with worldly spirit (1 Corinthians 2:12). This is affirmed in Romans 8:9, Galatians 5:16-17, John 14:26, and Ephesians 1:13.

questions.question: In 1 Corinthians 2:13, how do Paul and his companions communicate spiritual truths?
options: In words taught by the Holy Spirit, comparing spiritual things with spiritual
questions.correctAnswer: In words taught by the Holy Spirit, comparing spiritual things with spiritual
questions.explanation: Paul stresses the necessity of Spirit-led teaching when discussing spiritual matters (1 Corinthians 2:13). This aligns with John 14:26, 1 John 2:27, Romans 8:5-6, and Ephesians 6:17.

questions.question: According to 1 Corinthians 2:14, why does the natural man not accept the things of the Spirit of God?
options: Because they are foolishness unto him and he cannot know them
Because he is too wise to believe
questions.correctAnswer: Because they are foolishness unto him and he cannot know them
questions.explanation: The natural man cannot receive spiritual truths as they are spiritually discerned and seem foolish (1 Corinthians 2:14). This idea is supported by John 3:3-7, Jeremiah 17:9, Romans 8:7, and Psalm 14:1.

questions.question: Who, according to 1 Corinthians 2:15, is able to judge all things?
questions.correctAnswer: He that is spiritual
questions.explanation: Paul states that the spiritual person judges all things, but is himself judged by no one (1 Corinthians 2:15). This reflects biblical themes of spiritual discernment seen in Hebrews 5:14, 1 John 4:1, John 16:13, and Proverbs 3:5-6.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from 1 Corinthians 2:16: 'For who hath known the mind of the Lord, that he may instruct him? But we have the mind of ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: Christ
questions.explanation: Paul concludes by affirming believers have the mind of Christ, enabling them to understand God's will (1 Corinthians 2:16). This is supported by Philippians 2:5, Romans 12:2, Colossians 1:9, and Isaiah 11:2.

questions.question: How does Paul describe his own state when he was with the Corinthians in 1 Corinthians 2:3?
questions.correctAnswer: Weakness, fear, and much trembling
questions.explanation: Paul acknowledges his human frailty and fear when he first preached to them (1 Corinthians 2:3), highlighting reliance on God’s power. This humility is seen in 2 Corinthians 12:9, Psalm 34:4, Isaiah 41:10, and Philippians 4:13.
